text:
quate and well-controlled studies of [TRADENAME] in 
pregnant women.  The limited available information on [TRADENAME] 
use during pregnancy is not sufficient to inform a drug-associated risk of 
major birth defects or miscarriage.  In animal reproduction studies, oral 
administration of [drugname] to pregnant rats and rabbits during the 
period of organogenesis at doses up to 40 and 20 times the maximum 
recommended human dose (MRHD), respectively, resulted in decreased 
fetal body weight gain
